bill.title: Relative to multiple employer welfare arrangements.
bill.description: Relative to multiple employer welfare arrangements.

history.action: Introduced 02/04/2021 and Referred to Commerce; Senate Journal 4
Remote Hearing: 03/02/2021, 09:30 am; Links to join the hearing can be found in the Senate Calendar; Senate Calendar  12
Committee Report: Rereferred to Committee, 03/11/2021; Vote 5-0; Consent Calendar; Senate Calendar  14
Rereferred to Committee, Regular Calendar 23Y-1N, Motion Adopted; 03/11/2021; Senate Journal 7

bill.full_text: statement of purpose it is the purpose of this act to help small businesses obtain more affordable health care coverage and new coverage options through multiple employer group purchasing mechanisms as authorized in this chapter while preserving protections for higher risk individuals and groups and while protecting against adverse impacts on new hampshire s existing individual and small group health insurance markets welfare arrangements applicability general eligibility amend rsa to read as follows applicability no person shall after april operate a welfare arrangement unless such arrangement is approved by the commissioner no person shall after april operate a welfare arrangement in existence prior to april unless such arrangement has submitted for approval in compliance with rsa or otherwise meets the special requirements of paragraph iii of this section a foreign or domestic mewa or association shall be subject to the jurisdiction of this state if it provides a health benefit plan that covers the employees of at least one employer that maintains a work location in new hampshire which is the primary workplace of at least one new hampshire resident including any new hampshire resident who is qualified to enroll in the plan this chapter shall not apply to a welfare arrangement which offers or provides benefits which are fully insured by an authorized insurer or under the provisions of rsa rsa rsa rsa iii and rsa shall not apply to a welfare arrangement which a meets the general eligibility requirements of rsa i b is administered primarily from a principal place of business located within the state of new hampshire c has provided employee health benefits for a continuous period of or more years d maintains a termination liability fund wherein the fund balance plus the total liabilities of the welfare arrangement shall at no time for a consecutive period be less than percent of the aggregate amount of premiums billed during the prior months for purposes of this subparagraph that surety amount if any deposited with the commissioner pursuant to rsa i may be credited as a fund balance asset toward the termination liability fund amount required under this chapter and e files with the commissioner not later than months following the end of each fiscal year a report on the financial status of the termination liability fund which report is filed under oath by a member of its board of trustees or by an administrative executive duly appointed by the board and further certified to by an independent certified public accountant with a place of business located within the state of new hampshire in the event a welfare arrangement does not satisfy the requirements of paragraph iii the arrangement shall within days file with the commissioner an application for approval under rsa and shall be subject to all provisions of this chapter until such time as the requirements of paragraph iii are satisfied welfare arrangements the introductory paragraph of rsa and rsa i are repealed and reenacted to read as follows general eligibility pathway i and pathway to meet the requirements for approval and to maintain a multiple employer welfare arrangement an association shall be approved either as a bona fide pathway i or pathway ii association as follows an association seeking approval as a bona fide pathway i association shall a meet the definition in rsa ii of a bona fide pathway i association b sponsor health coverage that is c be nonprofit d be established by a trade association industry association political subdivision of the state religious organization or professional association of employers or professionals which has a constitution or bylaws and which has been organized and maintained in good faith for a continuous period of one year for purposes other than that of obtaining or providing insurance e be operated pursuant to a trust agreement by a board of trustees which shall have complete fiscal control over the arrangement and which shall be responsible for all operations of the arrangement the trustees selected shall be owners partners officers directors or employees of one or more employers in the arrangement a trustee may not be an owner officer or employee of the administrator or service company of the arrangement the trustees shall have the authority to approve applications of association members for participation in the arrangement and to contract with an authorized administrator or service company to administer the affairs of the arrangement f be neither offered nor advertised to the public generally g be operated in accordance with sound actuarial principles welfare arrangements rsa are repealed and reenacted to read as follows bona fide pathway association coverage general authorization bona fide pathway association coverage as set forth in the united states department of labor s june amendment to f r section fed reg codified at f r section shall be permissible in new hampshire provided it conforms with this chapter and all of the provisions of title xxxvii concerning this coverage bona fide pathway ii association coverage option to offer coverage a bona fide pathway ii association may offer coverage on a fully insured basis if it is licensed as a qualified purchasing alliance under rsa and meets all of the pathway ii requirements under this chapter no insurer shall issue a health benefit plan to an association or mewa with covered lives in new hampshire unless the association or mewa meets the requirement of a bona fide pathway ii association under this chapter has been licensed by the department as a qualified purchasing alliance under rsa a association or mewa that has been licensed by the department as a qualified purchasing alliance shall not be subject to the financial reporting and solvency requirements of this chapter that are applicable only to associations an insurer issuing a fully insured health benefit plan to an association or mewa shall ensure that the terms of the plan conform with all applicable requirements of this chapter with respect to bona fide association coverage and that the coverage has received all required approvals from the department bona fide pathway ii association coverage benefit requirements each health benefit plan offered to or by a bona fide pathway ii association whether on a fully insured or basis shall at a minimum provide the following benefits a coverage for each of the essential health benefits as defined in u s section b either in conformance with the new hampshire benchmark plan or subject to approval of the commissioner based on a showing of actuarial value equivalence to the new hampshire benchmark except that pediatric dental and vision coverage may be offered to the association in either a dental or vision plan or as a benefit embedded in the health benefit plan b cost sharing requirements of u s section c c c lifetime and annual limits as prescribed in f r section d a level of coverage equal to or greater than that designed to provide benefits that are actuarially equivalent to percent of the full actuarial value of the benefits provided under the plan and e all other benefits required to comply with applicable federal laws and regulations every health benefit plan offered by any bona fide pathway ii association whether offering coverage on a basis or fully insured basis and any insurer contracting with an offering association shall comply with the following a except as otherwise specifically provided herein all requirements of rsa including claims data and other reporting requirements b requirements contained in rsa and any rules adopted thereunder by the commissioner including but not limited to network adequacy balance billing protections and appeal and grievance processes c payment of premium tax as provided in rsa and administrative assessment under rsa d requirements pertaining to examinations under rsa e requirements pertaining to unfair insurance trade practices under rsa f vaccine association assessment under rsa and g individual market assessment under rsa no health benefit plan or related policy contract certificate or agreement offered or issued in this state to a bona fide pathway ii association shall reserve discretion to the insurer or sponsoring association to interpret the terms of the contract or to provide standards of interpretation or review that are inconsistent with the laws of this state any such policy contract certificate or agreement shall be void and unenforceable to the extent it conflicts with this section a bona fide pathway ii association shall not offer and an insurer shall not deliver or issue for delivery to a bona fide pathway ii association a health benefit plan covering lives located in this state that contains an exclusion or limitation for conditions or a waiting period on the coverage of conditions for any bona fide pathway ii association coverage that is issued to a sole proprietor the association or purchasing alliance sponsoring the coverage shall be responsible for monitoring and ensuring that the sole proprietor meets the requirements to qualify as an employer under f r section b and meets the per month hourly work requirement contained in rsa failure to ensure compliance with this provision shall be a violation of this chapter rating requirements for bona fide pathway ii association coverage rating requirements any bona fide pathway ii association or any insurer contracting with a bona fide pathway ii association to provide a health benefit plan shall comply with all requirements of rsa except that for a bona fide pathway ii association with or more new hampshire covered lives small group rating standards under rsa shall not apply regardless of the size of the member employer groups and the association as a whole may be rated as a single risk pool coverage for a bona fide pathway ii association with or more new hampshire covered lives may be rated as a single large group in accordance with all standards applicable to large employer groups under rsa the following additional requirements shall apply to such coverage a all premium rates charged shall be guaranteed for a rating period of at least months and shall not be changed for any reason including but not limited to a change in the group s case characteristics the association may vary rates among member small employers including participating new hampshire members as follows a variation associated with age shall not exceed b variation associated with tobacco use shall not exceed to c no other variation shall be permitted the same rating methodology shall apply to newly covered member employer groups and employee members renewing at each annual renewal date or anniversary date the rating methodology shall not be construed to include health carrier incentives to individual subscribers or members to participate in wellness and fitness programs provided such incentives are approved by the insurance department nothing in this chapter shall be construed to allow a member small employer group within any association to be rated separately under large group rating standards bona fide pathway ii association coverage nondiscrimination requirements in accordance with f r section bona fide pathway ii association coverage shall comply with the following the group or association shall not condition employer membership in the group or association on any health factor of any individual who is or may become eligible to participate in the group health plan sponsored by the group or association the group health plan sponsored by the group or association shall comply with f r section b with respect to nondiscrimination in rules for eligibility of benefits the group health plan sponsored by the group or association shall comply with f r section c with respect to nondiscrimination in premiums or contributions required by any participant or beneficiary for coverage under the plan in applying the nondiscrimination provisions of paragraphs ii and iii the group or association shall not treat the employees of different employer members of the group or association as distinct groups of individuals based on a health factor of one or more individuals bona fide pathway ii association coverage movement from bona fide pathway ii association coverage to small group coverage a small employer that leaves the small group market for bona fide pathway ii association coverage shall not be permitted to return to small group coverage for a period of months following the departure from the small group market nor shall an insurer be permitted to issue small group coverage to such a group unless the employer can demonstrate that association coverage is no longer available to that employer bona fide pathway ii association coverage mitigation of individual and small group market impacts of pathway ii association coverage in order to mitigate potential adverse effects of pathway ii association coverage on the existing individual and small group markets the following protective measures shall apply a prior to january the commissioner shall retain an independent actuarial firm to model and quantify the impacts of pathway ii coverage on the existing individual and small group markets and to perform the actuarial review necessary to support a section waiver as required in subparagraph b and the small group risk adjustment program required in rsa b prior to january the commissioner shall apply for a waiver under section of the patient protection and affordable care act u s section and under the commissioner s authority in rsa in order to create a risk subsidy mechanism for the individual market under rsa which is eligible to draw down federal funding to support such mechanism c the commissioner shall publish and accept public comment on the waiver application the plan of operation for the individual market risk subsidy mechanism and the plan of operation for the small group risk adjustment program required under rsa prior to approving such plans no pathway ii association coverage shall be issued to a sole proprietor until the waiver has been granted and the risk subsidy mechanism for the individual market has been put in place except that a pathway ii association that has established membership criteria that limit membership in the association to businesses that are members of or affiliated with an association trade group or other entity that has been in existence for at least years and was established and maintained for purposes other than the provision of health coverage may provide coverage to sole proprietor members commencing january the plan of operation for the small group risk adjustment program required under rsa shall be approved and in place by january health coverage definitions amend rsa xvi a to read as follows a small employer means a business or organization which employed on average one and up to employees including owners and persons on business days during the previous calendar year a small employer is subject to this chapter whether or not it becomes part of an association plan trust or any other entity cited in rsa provided it meets this definition provided that coverage written to a bona fide pathway ii association with at least new hampshire covered lives that meets all applicable standards under rsa and all large group standards under this chapter shall not be considered small employer coverage and may be offered to sole proprietors or persons health coverage guaranteed issue and renewability amend rsa iii to read as follows health carriers shall actively market issue and renew all of the health coverages they sell in the small employer market to all small employers except that a health carrier shall not be permitted to issue small employer coverage to a group that previously was covered as part of a bona fide pathway ii association under chapter rsa for a period of months after the date that the group initiated pathway ii coverage unless the group can demonstrate that association coverage is no longer available to that group purchasing alliances amend rsa to read as follows qualified purchasing alliance a purchasing alliance that has a minimum of enrollees may elect to obtain certification from the commissioner as a qualified purchasing alliance to obtain certification a purchasing alliance shall demonstrate that the purchasing alliance meets all requirements under rsa to operate as a bona fide pathway ii association and that certification of the applicant as a qualified purchasing alliance will promote the purposes set out in rsa and that the purchasing alliance has the capacity to monitor and screen sole proprietor members purchasing pathway ii association coverage to ensure that they meet all requirements to qualify as an employee under f r section b and meets the per month hourly work requirement contained in rsa risk adjustment program amend rsa to read as follows risk adjustment program the board shall a develop and monitor a measure of risk to be used in comparing populations covered by small employer health insurance coverage and bona fide pathway ii association coverage the population covered by qualified association trust coverage or by bona fide pathway i association coverage whether or fully insured shall not be a part of the risk adjustment program and for the purposes of this chapter shall not be considered to be small group coverage b access from the new hampshire comprehensive health care information system chis as described under rsa member level information including length of coverage gender age and diagnosis sufficient to measure and monitor risk for carriers issuing or administering small employer health insurance c perform risk adjustment analysis which may include the use of data from the chis including calculating new hampshire specific relative weights as necessary to analyze the difference in the medical care resources expected to be necessary to treat the different populations one covered in the small group insurance risk pool and the other covered by bona fide pathway ii association coverage d subject to the limitation in paragraph ii establish risk adjustment payments between carriers that are triggered whenever the average risk over any calendar year between bona fide pathway ii association coverage and all other small group coverage differs by more than the maximum allowed amount percent over any calendar year and that serve to create a net effect of reducing future expected risk score differences after payments to approximately the target amount the commissioner shall establish the maximum allowed amount and the target amount by retaining actuarial experts the standard that the actuarial experts shall use in recommending values for the maximum allowed amount and the target amount is that such amounts should be so determined as to prevent the pathway ii association market from having an adverse impact on the availability and choice of coverage in the small group market and to prevent adverse selection against the small group market that is sufficient to cause the average premiums for small groups to increase at a rate that is significantly higher than the trend in claims costs percent e provide a report to the insurance commissioner in a form and format acceptable to the commissioner the board shall not implement any adjustments until the number of lives covered by bona fide pathway ii association coverage exceeds member months for consecutive months repeal the following are repealed effective december rsa relative to eligibility coverage and rates rsa relative to assessments repeal the following are repealed relative to the prospective amendment of the definition of qualified association trust in rsa relative to the prospective amendment of rsa rsa relative to the commission on the status of health coverage markets for individuals and small employers the remainder of this act shall take effect upon its passage lba sb fiscal note as introduced agencies contacted insurance department
